section.title: Unique Index Scan
section.para: Request N rows matching a specific criteria using a unique index

figure.title: DB Index(es)
figure.programlisting: create index movie_utitle_idx on jpatune_movie(utitle)

figure.title: JPA Query
Generated SQL
figure.programlisting: select movie0_.ID as ID1_2_, movie0_.DIRECTOR_ID as DIRECTOR7_2_, movie0_.MINUTES as MINUTES2_2_, movie0_.PLOT as PLOT3_2_, movie0_.RATING as RATING4_2_, movie0_.RELEASE_DATE as RELEASE5_2_, movie0_.utitle as utitle6_2_ from JPATUNE_MOVIE movie0_ where movie0_.utitle=?

listitem.para: Index used to locate table rowId
Unique index scan used since index contains unique values

tip.title: Unique Indexes are more Efficient than Non-Unique Indexes for Specific Value Search
tip.para: DB knows there can be only a single match and stops index scan after first match found

section.para: All terms in the where clause part of same composite index

Select clause satisfied using table rows accessed by rowId

tip.para: Adding all terms of the where clause to the index can help efficiency over using a single column index.

figure.programlisting: create index movie_title_rating_idx on jpatune_movie(title, rating)

section.para: * this index contains columns from both the where and select clauses

listitem.para: Where clause satisfied using an index range scan

tip.para: DB will bypass rowId access to row if index already contains all columns necessary to satisfy the select clause.
